summary:
An engineer by training, I hold a Ph.D. in computational physics from University Pierre et Marie Curie in Paris. I have several years of experience in executing and leading software projects both in prototyping/research and production environments. 

My analytical skills combined with natural curiosity led me to successfully engage in different tech domains ranging from scientific computing to cybersecurity. I am currently combining my two main passions, physics and programming, by working on industry-relevant applications of quantum computers at Pasqal. 

The main driver of my work is to tackle complex deep-tech software projects and scale them from an initial innovative idea to full-fledged products delivering industrial value.
